this is funny
but not actually all that good

And waiting obviously
But a t2 kill isn't the worst

People are saying this card is junk because it's weaker than other wiz payoffs, but you don't play this instead of them. It's an extra attack. It's self contained, giving both the wiz and the multi hit attack for one card drawn and one energy.
You just toss this out after doing whatever else you need to do this turn
<Bang>

embeds.title: Whiz
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_gremlins: / The Gremlins / Downfall

Gain 1 (2) **Wiz** :p_wiz:. Next turn, gain a (an)  (**Upgrade**d) Bang.
**Exhaust**.

Bang (0 :energy_gremlins: card): Deal 0 damage 3 (4) times. Add a Whiz(+) to your discard pile. **Exhaust**.

messages.content:
There are just easier, less dangerous ways to stack wiz. Gremlins really need frontloading, because every turn that they can't deal damage/block appropriately, they risk getting destroyed by an attack and entering a death spiral. The ward generators fit much better into a gremlin wizard shell that tries to build up wiz for a big multi-hit attack, because they can also help you block on the current turn and prevent getting hit for 25+ damage. It is pretty cool that whiz provides both the setup and payoff for gremlin wizard, but I can' think of many situations where you would be focusing on gremlin wizard, and still need both of those effects added to your deck. Cat scratch and dagger dance both being at common make it very easy to find good payoffs for gremlin wizard without putting in this much risk.

I think this card can be reasonable as you head towards the later stages of the game and have a decent amount of card draw, and want to be able to sustain your bursts of damage to deal with higher health enemies. If you play it at the end of an already productive turn to setup for the next turn, or if you have the ability to discard it when it's bad to raid, then it can be a way to more consistently stack wiz and have good multihit payoffs. That's a relatively small niche though, and there are plenty of other powers that can provide a more consistent source of late game scaling damage.

The upgrade is pretty powerful, getting you extra wiz and increasing the number of hits from bang, so it's a more tempting card to take if it's pre-upgraded. Gets better with runic pyramid to find an off turn to cast this safely on, and potentially to hold bang/other multihits so you can use both with 3 stacks of wiz. Strength relics help this out, as do defensive relics like the boat trio to buy time for the setup.
this is definitely a card
